title: How to get royalty from a book if I publish my book through Amazon or Kindle - Quora

response.answer_text: When you initially publish the book, amazon will ask for what kind of royalty would one prefer, usually it is either 30 percent or 10 percent with each having it's pros and cons. Once your book is listed on Amazon and sales happen, you can see it in your amazon kdp control panel. Your royalty payment will be calculated on a monthly basis. The payment will start on the third month from the date of publishing. For eg , if your book got published in March , your payment for the whole of March will happen around the last of May; like wise royalty for April will be paid around the last week of July , so on and so forth. The payments are separate for each amazon domain. IE your royalties will be separate for amazon.uk, amazon.in, .Ca etc

They pay royalties on sales 60 days after sale. You get it immediately if you have DIRECT DEPOSIT, which means an American Routing Number and Account Number. Otherwise you have to accumulate $100, which takes forever. I just got notified yesterday by Smashwords of a royalty and Today from Draft2Digital of a royalty coming in 60 days.
Earn one first. Then you can have a direct deposit or a check, If you choose a check you have to wait until you have a hundred dollars due.
